pullRequest.title: First code cleanup of GenericExternalService
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR cleans up config parsing logic, so that config parsing logic is
centralized in EvergreenService and GenericExternalService.

Clean up 'status' field in EvergreenService. Subclass of EvergreenService should track its status separately.
Remove logic of parsing timeout from config in ShellRunner. Timingout logic is handled in EvergreenService lifecycle part.
Fix shutdown behavior of GenericExternalService. running process is killed after shutdown is called.

Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:
Why is this change necessary:
How was this change tested:
Ran KernelTest testSomeMethod() . Verify sleep process doesn't exist after test exits.
Any additional information or context required to review the change:
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

nodes.bodyText: Should this make sure that the current script is stopped or we kill it if not?
Do we really want to block forever here? That is the opposite of the original implementation. Just want to make sure that the result of this change was considered.

First code cleanup of GenericExternalService

This PR cleans up config parsing logic, so that config parsing logic is
centralized in EvergreenService and GenericExternalService.
1. Clean up 'status' field in EvergreenService. Subclass of EvergreenService should track its status separately.
1. Remove logic of parsing timeout from config in ShellRunner. Timingout logic is handled in EvergreenService lifecycle part.

nodes.bodyText: Why 17, why did this need to be changed?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -131,7 +131,7 @@ main:
     pwd
     printenv
     while true; do
-    date; sleep 5; echo RUNNING
+    date; sleep 17; echo HI_RUNNING

nodes.bodyText: Can we add a note here how currentScript and runScript should be used respectively?
Correct me if I'm wrong, serviceErrored(); will keep track of the error and try to recover later, while direct reportState() will not.

nodes.bodyText: Can the current script be not the exec for run due to race conditions ? example: run called and shutdown was called before this assignment happened.
This is used in the httpserver and cli, might want to update that
Can a race condition cause this currentScript to change between L165 and L170

beforeCommit.message: In GenericExternalService, reportState(Running) after start the running script.

afterCommit.message: In GenericExternalService, reportState(Running) after start the running script.

commit.message:
First code cleanup of GenericExternalService

This PR cleans up config parsing logic, so that config parsing logic is
centralized in EvergreenService and GenericExternalService.
1. Clean up 'status' field in EvergreenService. Subclass of EvergreenService should track its status separately.
1. Remove logic of parsing timeout from config in ShellRunner. Timingout logic is handled in EvergreenService lifecycle part.
1. Fix shutdown behavior of GenericExternalService. running process is killed after shutdown is called.
In GenericExternalService, reportState(Running) after start the running script.

beforeCommit.message: In GenericExternalService, reportState(Running) after start the running script.

afterCommit.message: In GenericExternalService, reportState(Running) after start the running script.
